intro: Pedilonum vannouhuysii, commonly known as the Van Houtte's pedilonum, is a rare and unique plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Pedilanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
